intro: Centaurea pullata, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, and the leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. Centaurea pullata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
